thread.title: Parents race to Buddy’s side as fiancee Jesinta Campbell urged to stay in Japan | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: Parents race to Buddy’s side as fiancee Jesinta Campbell urged to stay in Japan | DailyTelegraph

author: Andrea Hamblin, Rita Panahi and Lauren Wood
title: Parents race to Buddy’s side as fiancee Jesinta Campbell urged to stay in Japan | DailyTelegraph
text:
UPDATE: JESINTA Campbell has posted a message on Instagram thanking everyone for their support after her fiance Lance Franklin went public about his battle with mental illness.
Campbell, 24, is in Japan for TV travel show, Getaway , and is not expected back until the weekend.
Quote: : “I would like to thank everyone for the support both bud and I have received over the past few days. This is an extremely challenging time for us and has been for some time now, however it has been made easier by the love, understanding and support we have been given. Thinking of the many others who also live with this everyday and are not as fortunate to have the support we do.
Other Stories Mum saw son shot dead by police News 0 comments JT: No qualms boycotting Dally M Awards Nrl 0 comments ‘Burgers and babes’ joint coming soon Central Coast 0 comments Leigh Sales’ cutting question for Abbott Television Brayden’s desperate dash for survival West Why being an escort has made me a better mother Rendezview 0 comments “I am incredibly proud of Bud’s strength and courage, this has not been an easy journey. I am thankful for the support of the Sydney Swans, both of our families, friends and Sharon. We are not alone in this. My heart is with my man. The only thing I ask is that everyone respect our privacy at this time.”
She posted Lifeline’s number 13 11 14 along with the message: “It doesn’t matter how this looks to other people. If this is something that you gotta do, then do it. Fighters fight.”
I would like to thank everyone for the support both Bud and I have received over the past few days. This is an extremely challenging time for us and has been for some time now, however it has been made easier by the love, understanding and support we have been given. Thinking of the many others who also live with this everyday and are not as fortunate to have the support we do. I am incredibly proud of Bud's strength and courage, this has not been an easy journey. I am thankful for the support of the Sydney Swans, both of our families, friends and Sharon. We are not alone in this. My heart is with my man. The only thing I ask is that everyone respect our privacy at this time. Lifeline 13 11 14
